intro: Rosa × dumetorum subvar. acanthina, commonly known as the thorny shrub rose, is a hybrid species native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, and thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and the plant is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions. The flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive appearance and pleasant scent.
